newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugo's Sartid 12-mth steel output 750,000T - paper.
newsitem.headline: Yugo's Sartid 12-mth steel output 750,000T - paper.

text.p: Yugoslavia's iron and steel mill Sartid of Smederevo produced 750,000 tonnes of steel and steel plates and strips since its furnaces restarted in March last year, the Belgrade newspaper Politika said on Tuesday.

"Metallurgy production has been renewed thanks to foreign credits approved by banks from Switzerland and Lebanon," Sartid executive director for production Branko Grujic was quoted by Politika as saying.

The first quantities of crude iron began flowing from the blast furnace of the Smederevo complex on March 31, 1996, after a virtual standstill of nearly four years due to international sanctions against Yugoslavia, comprising Serbia and Montenegro.
The bulk of last year's output, or $85 million worth, was exported, the report said.
Sartid's export income in January stood at $20 million, and in February $15 million.

The Smederevo steel works plans to produce one million tonnes of steel and steel products in 1997, Sartid business relations deputy general manager Mirjana Blagojevic confirmed to Reuters. -- Amra Kevic, Belgrade newsroom +381 11 222 4305
